Reviews.Title: Durable, Simple Point-And-Shoot
Reviews.Author: Michael King
Reviews.Content: This camera is brand-spankin'-new. I bought mine at Wal-Mart for $270, $30 cheaper than most retailers. Many stores are selling out...the price is actually going up.Let's begin:This camera is COMPLETELY waterproof and fairly shockproof as well. Great for travel and vacations! Mine is bright yellow and comes with a nifty wrist strap, so it's hard to lose.The resolution is great for the price, the lens glass is sharp and the sensor works well indoors (but not at night, for the most part).My favorite feature is the HDR setting. For the uninitiated, HDR (High Dynamic Range) photographs are typically merged together from a sequence of light-medium-dark photos of the same subject. HDR allows for a very even exposure of highlights and shadows, when a normal photo would leave the sky bleached or the trees blackened. Some HDR photos look a bit surreal, but this is not a "professional" camera. The word which best describes this camera is "fun". It's just plain fun and easy to use.Some other nice features are:**The automatic wifi transfer to your PC (OR to your smartphone/tablet, just download the APP and hold the camera *ON* your device to ensure a connection)**The panoramic mode (works well with a steady hand and a well-lit area)Overall, a great little travel camera. I highly recommend this to families, since it's practically unbreakable and simply enough that a child can use it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera above and below the water line!
Reviews.Author: Craig P. Donovan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading the so-so reviews about the Nikon AW110.  The camera was too new to be in the stores so it was purchased sight unseen.  The bottom line is I could not have been more impressed with the performance of this camera.  My daughter used it during a week long vacation to a Hawaii, both while snorkeling and on land.  The underwater pictures and video's were great.  On land we got to try out the panorama features at the beach and the picture was perfect.  Could not be happier with this purchase.I only had 1 issue....Not sure what happened but I had to remove the battery to reset the camera just 1 time .  The other dozen or so WiFi transfers went without issue.

Reviews.Title: This camera does the job!
Reviews.Author: cynthia gurley
Reviews.Content: I researched long and hard before purchasing a P&S; underwater camera, I finally chose this one for two reasons 1. Fujifilm has done the most R&D; in the underwater camera game and 2. I had to buy something bc time was running out before I left for my vacation.So...I took my fuji down 15+feet and the photos came out amazing, I took it on several very rough catamaran trips even shooting video that sounded great and looked amazing. Of course the wind and sail were whipping in the mic but you could hear us laughing and having fun. I treated this camera much like I do my expensive one, padded case, always strapped to my wrist, except it got wet and sandy and went into my beach bag. I was super careful not to get tanning oils on it and rinsed it off within an hour. I only opened the battery chamber when absolutely necessary and only after the camera was allowed to air dry.Note for diving/snorkeling: If the sun is behind a cloud life underwater is pretty black and white... I thought my camera (and maybe my mask) was malfunctioning. If you dive in shallow water with the sand stirring up, pictures will be hazy. If you shoot at the surface on underwater mode you'll have red or purple photos.. (I'm no pro photog I know there's a red filter but can't remember why) My finger got in the lens only once during my 6 hours underwater, it was an easy crop. I did not use a float strap because they didn't feel right, the lanyard that comes with the camera cinches up nicely around my wrist. I held my camera up when I entered the water as not to bash it against the water.Battery Life:  the battery that came with the camera had good life, the backup off brand I bought... not so good. I think power levels fluctuate in other countries so a full charge wasn't always a full charge for me in Jamaica.Indoor/Outdoor photos: use the settings and available light wisely, your photos will be sharper.Wireless to my iPhone was so simple and fast. You don't need an internet connection to send to your device... GPS and clock were nice. I didn't have to wear a watch.So1. Easy to take single handed photos2. The power button is close to the shoot button but has a different texture, I turned it off and missed a few shots at first.3. Go easy on the battery chamber4. Watch out for tanning oils and lotions, I actually used a tiny bit of bar soap and water after handling it with oily hands and rinsed it very well.5. Buy a name brand back up battery6. Use a float strap if you plan to be on the water but it wasn't useful for me diving6. READ THE BOOKLET ... It's a very user friendly camera but you'll do better faster if you read through the book.This camera performed above and beyond my expectations. I highly recommend it for the water and beach.

Reviews.Title: Worked GREAT- Until it DIDN'T
Reviews.Author: Mglc
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this camera-I tried the NikonI tried a lower priced OlympusAnd then this- and I was say each one failed me-First off, I am easy on my electronics, casual picture taker at the pool, a little bit at the beach- The olympus and Nikon leaked on me within the first week.The Fujifilm xp200 took amazing pictures, the quality was exactly what I was hoping for.3 weeks in we were at the pool and the screen turned green and all the pictures were coming out red. Turned off the camera, took out the battery- everything was dry, no leaks.Put the battery back in turned on the camera and it took regular pictures, then went back to red pictures, green screen.Amazon returned the item no questions asked and refunded our money.

Reviews.Title: good looking and perfect pics & videos. would pick this over go-pro cameras
Reviews.Author: Khanh Nguyen "glacier bay dude"
Reviews.Content: as mentioned, perfect pics and video, better than go-pro, except no mounting . kids took it to white water rafting and swimming, use bluetooth to transmit pics to their smartphones flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: todd folker
Reviews.Content: i did lots of research before i bought this camera. out of all the waterproof ones, it seemed to be the best. i do alot of kayaking, and i take lots of pictures. i have a tremor from an accident, and between that and the movement of the boat,the picture stabilization was very important. it works great. i have taken shots of animals moving in the water and they came out clear. the camera takes the picture quickly (some cameras take a long time to catch the image)on a recent trip i tested the waterproof option when i dumped in the river. the camera performed flawlessly. there are several options that i have not used. it has a "mute" option that silences all the sounds from the camera. i like this because when you get in close to wildlife you dont want the camera beeping and scaring off the animal.i have taken some inside pics, but not many and have not had to use the flash, so i cant comment on that. i really like this camera and would suggest it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: HDScoot
Reviews.Content: I normally shoot with a Nikon DSLR for product pics and a Canon sure shot for engineering test setup shots, but have been searching for a waterproof camera. I decided, from my own comparisons and the reviews here, to purchase this unit. I am very pleased with this camera. I carry it in my motorcycle jacket pocket and am now not worried about any rain, et cetera, damage AND, the zoom is internal, ie, no accidental lens protrusion inside my pocket. I've used it for a few close-up, work related shots, hand held with one hand and the photographs were just what I needed. And the other day I did some timer shots = Not disappointed at all and am glad I chose this camera. For me, it's just what I needed.

Reviews.Title: The best camera for a beach vacation
Reviews.Author: Deanna
Reviews.Content: Being a professional photographer who shoots with high-end Canon equipment, I LOVE this camera! We bought this for a trip to Hawaii because we knew that we wanted to be able to photograph underwater. It was awesome to have on the beach because we didn't have to worry about sand damaging the device.Does it take photos as good as a cheap SLR? No of course not, it's a point and shoot, but I'm not going to spend hundreds of dollars on an underwater case for just a few photographs on vacation. I did haul my good camera in a protected bag to the beach everyday to get the killer shots, but I never was without this camera on our adventurous trip.We had so much fun with this that we photographed fish and beach photos everyday with it on our 12-day trip, but we did have to charge the battery every night so I wish the battery had lasted longer per charge. I wouldn't hesitate to buy this camera because of the battery life, but you will probably need to charge it every day you use it on a vacation because it's so much fun to use.Is it really shock proof? Yup! While on our trip, our 2-year old wanted to hold it and of course threw it across a stone walkway pretty hard as I watched it bounce for 5 feet in horror. It immediately shut off and I couldn't get it to work as I thought we had just broke our new camera, but my husband took out the battery and put it back in and it immediately worked. After a few dents to the front, it still works great.Does it shoot in RAW? Being someone who shoots in RAW I researched for an underwater camera that would shoot in RAW, but I don't think any of them do under $400. This camera only shoots in JPEG and after using it, I realized I could deal with it because underwater photos in the ocean are never great unless you have additional lighting and very clear water. This camera really excels in a pool, but I still recommended it for fun sea life. Also, the video is only 30 fps. It does not offer 24 fps, but I still had a blast recording video.My absolute favorite thing about this camera is that you can send photos to your phone or computer through bluetooth wirelessly. This was great on vacation because we could take underwater photos and instantly text them to our family and post them on our social websites.Moral of my review: BUY IT!

Reviews.Title: Xanax equivalent for outdoor and underwater photography :)
Reviews.Author: dpan10980 "Got Pulse!!!..."
Reviews.Content: Bought this for recent trip that involved water trips, hiking and animal safari. Wanted my kids to take pics without parents constantly reminding them not to break anything. We took camera 15 ft underwater, put it under the 90 ft waterfall and there were no leaks. Pics came out great in all conditions. 360 panorama takes some getting used to before you can get good shot. Battery drains a lot faster then other cameras in this range in my opinion. WiFi transfer is great, but make sure that power cord is connected if you are transferring a large amount of data. This camera is not a replacement for your dSLR but rather an addition to that.

Reviews.Title: Great all-around digital camera that happens to be waterproof
Reviews.Author: Gearhead Mania
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm XP200My friends use older FujiFilm XP waterproof cameras on the lake and in the river with great success, and the XP200 came highly recommended. However, my impression is that the XP200 is a great all-around digital camera that happens to be waterproof/shockproof. The XP200 also turns on almost instantly, so it is handy for those sudden situations on the water.The 16MP sensor takes rather good pictures! The 5x optical zoom is impressive, as there are no mechanical lenses that move around. There are multiple features like 3D, HDR, and panaromic shots. However, the 3D and panaromic features aren't as quite refined as I'd like. The panorama feature isn't nearly as good as the feature on my Samsung Galaxy S3 phone.The XP200 takes true HD video, but the odd thing is that it only does 1920x1080 at 60 frames per second, and a 32GB SDHC card only allows about 23 minutes of footage. That's roughly 190 Mbps in the Quicktime .MOV format, whereas a GoPro or Sony Action Cam or even my Samsung Galaxy S3 would take 1920x1080 at 30 fps in roughly 20-30 Mbps in AVHCD MP4 format.The thing I really did not like is the fact it uses a proprietary USB cable. It is about the same size as micro-USB, which has almost become a standard among mobile electronics manufactured in 2010 and beyond. However, it happens to be specific to the XP200. I don't like this because I already keep a bunch of AC adapters on a power strip and they each have an assortment of micro-USB and mini-USB cables. Now I have to keep track of a proprietary USB cable designed for the XP200.The photos have good overall clarity. They are not going to be professional grade, but would be great for Facebook posts, sharing, and even scrap books.The video quality is quite good, about on-par with my Samsung Galaxy S3 which both blow the GoPro Hero3 out of the water. Here are the specs on the videos that the XP200 produces in comparison to the other devices:1920x1080P at 30 fps unless otherwise specifiedFujiFilm XP20059.94 fps, AVCHD, Main Profile, Level 4.1, 2 reference frames, 18.7 Mbps data rateSamsung Galaxy S3 (4.1.2)AVCHD, High Profile, Level 4.0, 1 reference frame, 17 Mbps data rateGoPro Hero 3 SilverAVCHD, Main Profile, Level 4.1, 4 reference frames, 30.2 Mbps data rateSony HDR-AS10 Firmware 1.03MPEG-4 Sony PSP, AVCHD, Main Profile, Level 4.0, 2 reference frames, 16.0 Mbps data rateSony HDR-AS10 Firmware 2.0059.94 fps, MPEG-4 Sony PSP, AVCHD, Main Profile, Level 4.2, 2 reference frames, 25 Mbps data rateOverall: 4.5/5 stars. It would be 5/5 stars if it used a standard micro-USB cable. Everything else about the camera is really good! The waterproofness and shock protection is just icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Shelter Dawg
Reviews.Content: I've used this a few times diving (max 30ft) and it has been great.  The pictures turn out clear and the wifi transfer program works great for downloading to your phone except that it only transfers pictures, not movies.  The downside is that it goes through a battery charge quickly, less than 100 pictures.  Also, I have noticed a few water droplets in the sealed door when I plug in my charger.  It hasnt caused a problem yet but it is something I will monitor.  If this were a $150 camera, then I would give it 5 stars but for being close to $300 I expected zero issues with this.  Overall still a great buy for a camera to take diving.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures in AND out of the water
Reviews.Author: Herman Hundley
Reviews.Content: Took this camera on my honeymoon to Jamaica and used it for hundreds of photos, both in and out of the water and they all look incredible. Camera is very durable and did well with all of the abuse the sand and salt water put on it. Only flaw is that the sand seemed to wear some of the thin rubber film off of the case around the edge of the LCD but nothing noticeable or impactful.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Joshua Poris
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our cruise to Jamaica and Grand Cayman. Not one problem, Took it to the Dunns River Falls and took outstanding quality pictures no glare no fogginess crystal clear pictures. i then took it on our dive trip in Grand Cayman and again perfect underwater pictures awesome detail on the fish and reefs. Even the video mode works great underwater. Very impressed with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Durable like it says, but not very good underwater photos
Reviews.Author: miss joanna r juntila
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera strictly because I was traveling to Costa Rica and needed a durable camera with water proof features. It definitely is durable. I dropped it a few times during my hike on the hanging bridges and at the waterfall. The quality of the pictures underwater were horrible. zoom feature really sucks underwater. to get a great picture of any sea animals, you need to be pretty close to them. I definitely would recommend a floatation attachment for your camera so it'll float instead of sink if for any reason the camera slips off of your wrist. Overall, it did what its supposed to do. I just wish the quality of the underwater feature was more improved!

Reviews.Title: What a great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Christine McDonald
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera for that all around vacation! We used it in the water snorkeling and Snuba! Wonderful clear crisp pictures. We used it for still photos when out to dinner at night. The flash works wonderful and the camera has a great auto setting for detecting the conditions are to take the pictures. The zoom is great for us, we took pictures even during parasailing. We are not professional photographers and just wanted some good pictures to remember our trip. We were very happy to get absolutely beautiful pictures from everything we did. Our friends are now buying one for our next trip too! Super easy to use, love the WiFi ability! Great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Took it scuba diving up to 14m
Reviews.Author: Anuj Malhotra "AM"
Reviews.Content: As photography enthusiast, I will prefer DSLRs for picture quality over this one. My guess is there are better cameras. But if you like to do underwater photography, water proof camera, or looking for a shock proof camera this is one of the best. Picture quality is not bad, but we compared to some great mobile phones/SLRs. We took it underwater for scuba diving for a 14m dive and 30min. It did just fine and took nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working on the first day
Reviews.Author: Felipe
Reviews.Content: On the first day using the camera on water (less than 10 inches, unbelievable) all buttons stopped working. I read carefully the manual before using the camera, so it wasn't something I did wrong. I had to contact fujifilm in Brazil to use the warranty. I received an email saying they are going to reimburse me since they don't have the model in Brazil yet. For me was a terrible deal, I couldn't take pictures in my vacation (why I bought the camera) and now I need to return to the US to buy a new camera..

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: DarlaLIVE
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  I have used it several times at the lake now, in and out of the water.  I like to keep it with close with me while I am kayaking and it is great for fast one handed movie filming. I can zoom in and out without blur.  Takes great photos and has a pretty good zoom for not extending.  I have been able to get some excellent wildlife photos. The feature that lets you shoot in black and white but keep one color is more fun than I thought it would be.  Certainly wouldn't use it all the time, but it really is kinda cool.  My favorite thing is that is that the auto mode works great so although there are many good settings to choose from, I like feeling confident in just pointing and shooting, especially when I'm outdoors playing around.  I do like the wifi feature too, easily transferring photos to my tablet as soon as I get in.  I was disappointed that it does not have GPS and have not taken the time to load coordinates from my phone as it says to do.  I'd much rather it just have GPS, but the rest of the features and feel of the camera make it worth it for me.I initially gave it a great test in a bucket of water before I took it out to the lake.  I picked up 2 float straps to try, an Olympus and a Pentax. I was concerned because of the weight of this camera but both worked.  The Olympus was much better though because the float is much more visible on top of the water.  The Pentax was pulled into the water leaving just a very small part of the float visible.  I can splash around all I want on my kayak with my camera and not be concerned in case it were to fall in, it floats with the float strap.I just can't see someone being disappointed by this camera.  I LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Tess Burridge
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased the XP60 on vacation in Hawaii, and for the price wasn’t expecting great quality. The XP60 completely surpassed all expectations, until I started scuba diving… You can’t take the XP60 very deep, and therefore it isn’t reasonable for that activity. I couldn’t believe how much the already good quality of the XP60 was improved in the XP200. If you’re wondering why yellow is the best color for a camera underwater, it’s because other colors become unclear passed about 20 feet, yellow doesn’t lose color at all! The picture quality of the XP200 is also much better. To anyone into water sports, or otherwise: this is a great camera for a great price, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a tough, affordable, and versatile camera.

Reviews.Title: Quality of Pictures is so so, noisy image stabilizer
Reviews.Author: Carlos' Review
Reviews.Content: The camera feels solid. However, when compared with traditional point and shoots from Canon and Nikon it lacks in picture quality. The optical image stabilization system makes a lot of noise and gets video ruined. When selecting Full HD video recording, the 32GB card I bought says I can only record 24 minutes which doesn't make sense when you compare compression rates from the same card makers. This means that this uses a highly inefficient compression rate or it does not read the card right. Having said the negatives, I did purchase this camera mainly for activities near the pool or at the beach, so I don't ruin my other camera. It does the waterproof well and is not the most expensive in the market.

Reviews.Title: Great performance
Reviews.Author: SewardQA
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. I love the WIFI connection to send pictures to my phone. I travel for work and this is perfect for my work photos.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with our purchase
Reviews.Author: Sabrina
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to capture all the first moments of our daughter and it has completely met our expectation's. We were looking for something durable just in case it got dropped and liked that it could be used under water (at this time we have not tested out how water proof it truly is). We like the ability to take video and the pictures are very nice quality!

Reviews.Title: tuff camera
Reviews.Author: curtis neff
Reviews.Content: it is a tuff camera that takes very good pics a little bulky to carry i have not been able to work all the fetures yet but would buy this camera agin it can hold up to bad coditions. recommend

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL, EXCELLENT, LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: AGunnoe "ARG"
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of the first Fuji FinePix waterproof cameras years ago.  Loved it so I decided to upgrade.  These are durable, high quality cameras that take great pictures - underwater, dropping from the sky or in your house.  My original camera survived whitewater class 5 and greater trips, skydiving 10,000 ft, deep sea diving, water parks with 2 kids and a husband who destroys all things electronic.  Small, convenient, compatible, multi-functional.  I highly recommend any of the Fuji FinePix cameras.  The battery life is great.  The original Fuji FinePix camera battery is still in the camera after 10+ yrs and multiple recharges and still works great.  The video clips are very good as well.

Reviews.Title: CameraMan
Reviews.Author: Joe Consumer
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to operate.  Small in size.  Well constructed.  Waterproof without question!  Used it while on a week river rafting trip.  Flawless in operation and fantastic high resolution pictures!  I recommend this camera over other waterproof makes.  Check the reviews of this camera and the other manufactures.  Want no leaks, this is the one to take to the water!

Reviews.Title: happy with product
Reviews.Author: anguspine
Reviews.Content: Researched online for best underwater camera that would not break budget. I liked the reviews of this one best. Just got back from using it on a 7 day snorkel trip along the gulf. After downloading photos and movies I am very happy. Photos above and below water turned out great. the features that sold me on this are: 10-shot burst, movie and photo buttons separate, latch tight battery compartment, ability to snap photos during movie mode. I found previous reviews of button placement/configuration being easy to use underwater spot on. There are still a lot of features I have not explored but i am very happy with the purchase. I bought the chums wrist strap and that worked great too.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!
Reviews.Author: c. naitsirhc
Reviews.Content: I gave it 5 stars because it does everything I wanted it it to do and more.I probably spend more time at the beach than any other place and I had been looking for an underwater camera for a while. Looked at several cameras with similar features and around the same price range and ended up choosing this one and I'm so very happy I did. I've had it for about month and I've taken hundreds of pictures, above and underwater and I'm impressed. Works magnificently as a regular point&shoot; and it does a great job with underwater photos as well. All the photography settings are very cool. The camera itself is built very well, it feels very solid and sturdy. I'm not a pro so I don't know about all the technical details some of you might want to know about it, but I use cameras recreationaly, a lot, and this has been one of the best I've ever had. I seriously recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excelent pics and video - Noisey Audio on video from camera functions
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: So Far so good! Quality of pics is excellent, Camera Shooting Modes work really well - especially the SR Auto mode - very intuitive! I have yet to get good audio on the video clips - LOTS of noise still coming in from the auto focus, etc. I have yet to take it in the water but plan to next summer and will update if anything goes wrong! I've attached a clip that I shot in which you can hear the sound. I am trying to get Fugi to fix the audio (REALLY BAD) but so far they are saying there's nothing they can do... If you are looking for good audio on your video clips, this is NOT THE CAMERA FOR GOOD AUDIO!

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: AZPredPilot
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for our Maui trip. Two days into the trip and it has performed admirably. Was also considering the Olympus TG-2 since it has a faster f2.0 lens but I have not been disappointed with my choice. Great underwater photos.

Reviews.Title: YEAH
Reviews.Author: r.a.
Reviews.Content: Better version than XP50! It's fast and rugged.  New features -(HDR, Advanced Filters, 360, Shutter 3D, Wireless transfers, Slow-Mo movies)

Reviews.Title: Noise with Video Replay
Reviews.Author: Paul Sekulic
Reviews.Content: The camera feels durable.  Good rubber plastic construction.  Pan feature is nice. However, during playback of video a noticeable intermittent buzz/hum could be heard.  Might be associated with the focusing of the lense.  I don't know if this is typical or just a faulty item.  Daylight photo's were decent and the ability to take pictures quickly without using the multipicture function was pretty decent.  Image quality doesn't compare to a digital DSLR.  I was hoping it would be better than my iPhone but not really.  Flash was super bright.  Tended to wash out the pictures.  Overall disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Leaked and broke the first time I took it snorkeling
Reviews.Author: Andrew Conway
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this. It works fine on dry land, but after a few minutes of snorkeling, never more than two feet deep, water got inside the case and it stopped working. I hoped this model would be better quality than the cheaper waterproof cameras, but no such luck.

Reviews.Title: Tested to 60+ feet under water
Reviews.Author: Cooper
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on several dives and kept it submerged at around 60' for nearly an hour with a max depth of 63 feet. It performed great and had no damage from the pressure.I was happy with the underwater pictures and video; however, the underwater shooting mode does not adequately correct the green tint that is common with any underwater camera. I believe there's a mode to apply a red filter, but I haven't tried it yet. I'm hoping that may work better than the underwater mode.The picture and video quality is great both above and below water. The sound is great as well.I have several complaints with this camera, though all are fairly minor: - The button placement is awkward, especially the zoom. It would be better to have the zoom near the shutter for use with your right forefinger or at the bottom of the camera for use with your thumb. It's nearly impossible to zoom without holding the camera with both hands. - The zoom is quite jerky and slow to focus, so it's not suitable to zoom while filming. - Similar to many (especially older) compact digital cameras, there is a large lag between shots. - The LED light works okay for filming at night, but it's quite frustrating that it's always on (doesn't wait until you hit record) and then it doesn't turn back on if you switch the camera on and off. - The menus take too long to flip through. Once you memorize where you want to go it's not too bad, but the menus could be much easier to navigate, especially to functions that you need to get to quickly and frequently.Overall, I'm very pleased with this camera, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Of all the digital cameras that I've owned over the last decade, this one has to be the fastest, sharpest, and most robust of them all.  Usually we have a blur rate of 20% on earlier cameras... I'd say this camera is 5% or less -- including underwater shots.  Sharp.  Simple, and Wife-approved (as primary user).

Reviews.Title: Excellent Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: This undoubtedly is a five star camera. I purchased the camera to use on a Caribbean cruise as we were stopping at several islands and I was planning on doing some snorkeling and wanted to capture underwater images. The pictures were clear and the movies were spectacular. I did a lot of research on Amazon but more importantly YouTube to see how the camera performs. The camera overall is a bit larger than compact cameras but I could still fit it in my shorts pocket. The only issue I have with the camera is the charging process, the cord needs to be plugged into the camera with the camera door open (there is not a separate charger for the battery) but this does save space in the camera case. I did purchase and additional battery in case the original one died during the day but I did not have to use it at all. After all day of pictures and movies the battery was indicating a recharge so I plugged it in overnight. Charging from near empty to full is about an hour or so. I'm not one to really ramble on about a review but I feel this camera deserves some positive attention. I'm looking forward to using it in pool with the kids and at the beach this summer!!!

Reviews.Title: Great for hiking and backpacking
Reviews.Author: Angela M Hubbard
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera specifically for hiking and backpacking because it is waterproof and shockproof. While I love it's 16MP images, I did give up features I would have liked in a camera for the previously mentioned features. It doesn't seem to like taking pictures in low light at all, but that may be operator error since I don't know how to use all of the features yet. Over all I love this camera for it's ruggedness and quality images (hopefully I figure out how to use all of the features better lol).

Reviews.Title: excellent!
Reviews.Author: Gen
Reviews.Content: completely in love with this camera! I took it on my trip to Hawaii and it took beautiful pictures underwater and above. Recommend this for everyone :)

Reviews.Title: Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara Miller
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! Easy to operate! Takes quality pictures! I haven't gotten it wet yet, but am looking forward to being able to take pictures on the boat this summer!

Reviews.Title: Really nice
Reviews.Author: albert grundle
Reviews.Content: Just what I wanted it to be, small but capable, rugged with a nice solid feel about it, none of that plastic feel. I wear glasses and sometimes the displayed info is hard to read, not with this one. I recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: my first digital camera
Reviews.Author: christopher a roach
Reviews.Content: This my first digital camera,has all the bells and whistles,shock resistant,you can drop it from 6ft,and even go under water up to 50 ft,HD +wifi Its the coolest little camera i have ever owned,(and i have been into photography since i was a child) Took a little bit to figure out all it does,because i didnt read instructions first nor am i very computor litterate,But it comes with a nice CDrom for instruction,even gives you a photo shop,to do all that photo tricks etc.The only thing i didnt like is that it didnt come with a case or somthing to store it in,It fit into my old olympus case that the camera replaced.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Eileen Podhasky
Reviews.Content: Bought this to use while snorkeling in while on vacation as an Ikelite case for my other camera was almost twice (2 times) what the camera cost and more than three (3) times what this camera cost.  Went in the Caribbean many times with no problems at all.  I was always careful to let it soak in fresh water for at least ten (10) minutes, usually much longer, to get rid of any remaining salt water, then towel dried it, then let it air dry for an hour or so before opening to charge or transfer photos to the laptop.  Did not have any moisture problems at all.  My only quibble is that it takes video in 1080i vs 1080p, but you can take stills at full resolution while taking video.  Overall an excellent buy that I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good rugged pocket cameras
Reviews.Author: Robert L'Hommedieu
Reviews.Content: Overall, I'm really am happy with this camera. The only reason I didn't go to 5 stars is the very limited zoom capability.  I knew it would be from the specs, but didn't think it would be a big deal, but it would much better with more zoom.  On the other hand, I had concerns about battery life due to some other reviews I'd read.  My experience so far has been very satisfactory.  I've taken several hundred pics many with flash, lots of on/off, lots of standby time and the battery indicator still is showing a full charge. I've owned serveral other Fuji cameras over the years and have had good service from all of them.  I expect this model will also do well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product and service. Very easy handling and use.
Reviews.Author: Jose Franca
Reviews.Content: Easy to take single handed photos. The power button is close to the shoot button but has a different texture, I turned it off and missed a few shots at first.This camera performed above and beyond my expectations. I highly recommend it for the water and beach.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mking
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a month and I love it I used it last night at a party with low light so dark you actually could not tell what you was taking a picture of and they came out amazing.

Reviews.Title: Mine worked well, I tested it, then used it,
Reviews.Author: Chandler "J. O."
Reviews.Content: Sound is a little distorted when it comes out of the water so clear out the water by turning the mic side downward after being submerged to get best sound recording back. Worked in the pool, worked in the ocean. Took it about 15-20 feet down, had it submerged at that depth on and off for an hour. It spend hours floating in the pool on and off, worked fine.

Reviews.Title: Wow - what else to say?
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: This camera rocks.  The family used it extensively outdoors in major snow storms recently and it does a nice job in even low light.  Video is astounding on my 25 inch HP monitor and the pictures are great.  I paused the video to talk to wife and looked back to see t froze a perfect snow cloud around the dogs head puffing through the snow.  WOW! Watta hoot!  What more could you want from a camera?  My 35 mm would have died 3 times and I would have avoided the conditions.  Therefore - No pics no video no magic.  I can't say much for underwater but I can't imagine a problem.  Keep it sealed.  Keep the dirt out.  Want some stress and practice for babying a camera?  I have a 35 MM I mentioned above that will turn your hair gray trying to avoid damage..

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: robhercdragon
Reviews.Content: My family is having a blast with this camera. It goes everywhere and takes good, effortless pictures and video for a point and click camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Brett Langley
Reviews.Content: Basically can act as a Go-Pro... took lots of quality pictures under water, and on the ground. I haven't used the video tools near as much yet but I've had it in the ocean and dropped it from waist height with no noticeably negative results. Looks clean, did the job for my vacations. Not much of a professional photographer myself so I can not attest to any high definition quality aspects. I enjoy it for the price and my wife definitely loves it too.

Reviews.Title: An item I would promote
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: I picked this item because I have one and purchased this fo a relative that seen it while I had mine.  A very good camera for water sports or just shooting in the ocean or outside and not worrying about weather conditions.  Pictures came out very well.

Reviews.Title: I like this camera
Reviews.Author: A. Crawford "Glider Mom"
Reviews.Content: The camera isn't very heavy. It is a little heavier and a tiny bit bigger than my cool pix. I like the rubber bumps on it, when it gets wet this makes it easy to hold. The lanyard that comes with it is adjustable (I have a small wrist).I have had it in water and it worked fine. It worked just as it should. I am looking forward to taking it to the beach this summer, I'm interested in how it works in the sand.The pictures are just as good as my Nikon and Kodak cameras.  It has many different settings and of course includes auto which worked very well. It actually shows you what setting it's on.One of the reasons I chose this camera was the wifi capability. It took me a few minutes to figure it out (no user guide) but it does work very fast and I found it to be very consistent.The only thing I didn't like: it only comes with a sheet that tells how to put the battery in and talks about how to make sure the door is closed. It doesn't tell how to use any functions (including wifi). You have to look at the user's guide online and it is hard to navigate.

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera!
Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon in June and took this camera along (mostly for the waterproof feature) and we got some really great underwater photos, the photo quality of the camera is AMAZING!So why only 4 stars? Well, even on the fastest shutter speed, moving objects are really hard to get with this camera. If the lighting isn't just right and you don't snap at just the right time, the picture will come out blurry. Just something to keep in mind.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have only used the camera underwater once so far and it performed as expected. A few of my land shots have come out blurry but it may just be a matter of getting used to the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, love the underwater capability
Reviews.Author: Kevin Adams
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a trip to the Caribbean, and it worked great both below water and above. Sharp pictures, decent sound on the video. Would love more than a 5x zoom, but what do you expect from a sealed camera with no protruding lense?

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: I used it straight from the box settings. All I did was charge the batteries and it was ready to go. It took awesome snorkling photos on vacation.  I still haven't read all the other great features this camera has but so far just the basic use is fantastic. So far it's a keeper and the picture quality is great!!

Reviews.Title: Have recommended it for travelers!
Reviews.Author: Kelsey H.
Reviews.Content: So far (~6 months) this camera has held up to 15+ trips to the beach and several trips underwater. It takes excellent pictures and the wireless transfer feature is awesome both at home to my computer and while on vacation - allowing me to transfer picture to my iPad to be sent to friends and family. The resolution is great for the compact package.I opted out of a warranty and hope that I don't regret it - love the camera so far!

Reviews.Title: top performer
Reviews.Author: fotahmo
Reviews.Content: this will be my 4th waterproof camera, and it is by far the best. The dry-land shots rival my very expensive cameras. The 10fps burst mode has let me get great shots of wildlife too!

Reviews.Title: The BEST portable point-&-shoot lightweight camera I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: H. von Spaeth
Reviews.Content: This new Fuji FinePix XP200 camera really delivers!  The Fuji FinePix XP200 digital camera offers numerous high-end features.  This is the first compact camera I have owned that does an amazing job with regard to Panorama shots.  I'm a SCUBA diver and can't wait to take it down under.  This camera offers two, underwater shooting modes including "underwater-Macro" mode. Photos are crystal clear and rival that of my high-end SLR Nikon camera.  Transferring images wirelessly to my Smart phone and PC is a snap.  The FinePix XP200 has a very durable exterior.  The supplied AC charger/adapter is super-low profiled and is easy to pack when on extended trips. The flash is bright and gives just the right amount of lighting to consistently and perfectly illuminate each photo you take.  HD movies come out great too!  I played back movies and stored images via the mini HDMI port on my flat-screen television.  All I can say is, WOW!  This Fuji FinePix XP200 camera really delivers.  I just purchased a supplemental 32-GB memory card from Amazon.com which will give me peace of mind knowing I don't have to take numerous flash memory cards with me when away on extended trips.  You're going to love this camera.  Buy with confidence!

Reviews.Title: It's a winner!
Reviews.Author: Billy B. Taylor
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and HD video and is waterproof. Used it on a recent backpacking trip in Arkanas for 5 days. For something like this you will need extra batterys. Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Can't say anything bad about this!
Reviews.Author: CDoerr
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a great waterproof and sand proof camera with good quality video and this is it! I took a lot of time to do my research and landed on the XP200. The easy to use wi-fi transfer is a bonus and works perfectly with iPhone 5 and 2nd generation iPad. Tested it in my pool before going on vacation. Worked great in the pool then worked great on the beach and in the ocean.  I was glad I bought and brought the extra battery and the charger though, because the wifi transfers drain the battery faster than normal use (taking pic and videos).

Reviews.Title: The Best of Many!
Reviews.Author: Michael A Slivers
Reviews.Content: I have owned multiple point and shoot digital cameras over the years.  This one is simply the best.  Rugged, easy to use, did I say rugged?  Turn it on and take the shot, that all happens quickly.  If you like to shift to other modes, the FinePix XP200 does so effortlessly.  Want to take pictures on full auto, the SR Auto setting will amaze you, I personally like the automatic Macro focusing and stunning low-light exposures.  If you are a digital SLR fan (I am too) with a case full of interchangeable lenses, get one of these in your favorite color and put it in your pocket (it is rugged) for a rainy, snowy, dusty or bumpy day.  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Happy customer
Reviews.Author: Philip Shaffer
Reviews.Content: Excellent product.  Does a good job of everything I've asked of it.  Is my carrying around camera.  Even the kids use it.

Reviews.Title: Loved pics and features, couldn't take the overheating
Reviews.Author: Christen Tomme
Reviews.Content: This was a great little camera to get nice and excited over.  Waterproof to 20 feet, all those great features, HD video, stereo audio... all that stuff was awesome.However, I HAD to return this camera.  It was going to just frustrate me and make me kick myself for spending the money if I didn't!I bought this for the waterproof-ness, which was also fine, but in 75 degree weather, over the course of a few sunny days, this thing overheated 6 or 7 times while I'm shooting video!  It would simply say it's getting too hot and had to shut down.  IN THE MIDDLE OF MY VIDEO'ING!  So, I ended up with incomplete videos of the events I was shooting.  I had to open the side door that houses the battery and SD card, and blow into it and try to cool it down so I could resume shooting.  And even then, after a little time outside in the sun, it would overheat again.  I missed some good moments on our cruise because of it, and have incomplete vids now.PS: I live in Texas.  It's NOT hot outside yet.  If this is how the camera reacts in moderate temps, I'd be SCREWED shooting with it in a Texas summer!Another thing, the videos only shoot for a length of about 21 minutes each.  Then you run out and have to start a NEW video, so if you're video'ing something longer, say a wedding, you'd have gaps where you'd have to start a new video.  This is regardless of how much space your SD card has on it.  You're limited to 21 minute video times.So again, I WANTED to love this camera and use all the great features and look forward to the great pics I was going to get swimming in the ocean and lying on sandy beaches... but this ain't the cam for it.  :(  I believe the waterproofing has left it without proper ventilation and thus it'll overheat on you in even moderate temperatures.

Reviews.Title: Perfect on the go with family
Reviews.Author: Melissa A Carlson
Reviews.Content: so far an awesome camera for on the go picture taking with my fast paced family. I've had it for a month and aside from the multiple functions I haven't used or figured out it's a great purchase!!only regret is the battery dies quick or the button gets bumped and turns on without me knowing. so I've already been caught at a football game with no battery left.compared to other compact cameras this is amazing because the lense does not come in and out of the camera. other cameras have been dropped by the kids with the lense out making it completely useless.

Reviews.Title: Whirs and dies
Reviews.Author: DawnG
Reviews.Content: We took this camera to Tahiti to take underwater photographs.  It makes a tremendous amount of noise as it takes photos underwater and uses a lot of battery power when doing so.  The photos are not as clear as the previous model.  I am not pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: amazing!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kassandra Green
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a couple months ago. I read reviews on it, but ultimately was doubtful if it would be as great as it sounded. As soon as I received it, I dumped it in the water and took pictures immediately. In simple terms, this js the ultimate camera. Great pictures in hd quality, amazing underwater pics! I would purchase this camera ten times over, well worthit! I wouldnt own anything but this camera now! I loved it so much I purchased one for my sister. Love, love, love!!!

Reviews.Title: The best camera ever
Reviews.Author: calvin62
Reviews.Content: This one is the best camera for outdoor activities, just turn it on and shoot, doesn't matter the light, movement, or the situation, this one is the best camera you can get, good definition and very nice pictures, don't miss any picture ever.

Reviews.Title: Taking and Downloading Pictures is Difficult
Reviews.Author: Mendi
Reviews.Content: The actual pictures are good, and the camera seems durable.  Taking the pictures can be a problem.  The buttons are not responsive, so I have missed some good shots because the shutter button will not depress to take the picture.  You have to push it exactly right.  Same with the on/off button.  Forget about taking pictures if you have gloves or fat fingers.  Then transferring pictures to the computer is a problem.  You have to download a lot of programs, and it will not work without doing that.  Then, I have to use an old program for a different camera, and Picasa, to straighten and resize the pictures.  There is very little editing functionality that I can figure out on this camera.  If it's there, it's too complicated to be useful.

Reviews.Title: Quality just not there
Reviews.Author: Bill M.
Reviews.Content: While the wireless transfer of photos worked fine, the unit I received had very poor image quality (my mobile phone does a better job) and the charge indicator did not work. Returned.

Reviews.Title: Very good results
Reviews.Author: Thomas Ackermann
Reviews.Content: Used the camera both underwater and above with very good results. Picture quality was good and the underwater video was impressive. Nice to have a relatively rugged camera to take snorkeling and to the beach.

Reviews.Title: Works great and survives water.
Reviews.Author: BuNoHe
Reviews.Content: The camera works great, does what it says, and survives water use with ease!  I paid the 200 for the yellow since I'm not made of money and wasn't going to spend the extra 100 to get a 'pretty' color.  When I got it I realized that this color was just as awesome if not better than the others.  It's easy to see in water.Though I never got to go any deeper than 20 feet, I took it on different outings over a three day period.  The first day I took it snorkeling for probably around 3 hours.  The pictures are great quality and the video is also great!  Actually they are better than my other more expensive cameras.  I was so impressed!  The second day I took it on a thirty minute Scuba dive at around 20-25 feet and it worked great!  I had people coming up to me in the water and with gestures asked me to take pictures of them with their friends.  When we surfaced everyone wanted to know where I got it and how much it was.  The third day was a mix of snorkeling and beach use.  It got covered with sand and my little cousin dropped it a few times.  There was once when I jumped off the boat and it slammed onto the concrete.  Not even a scratch!  It still works great!  No problems AT ALL!Of course I follow the directions and set it in fresh water for about ten minutes and then take it out and let it dry.  This is to get all the sand and particles off the camera before you open it up to change the battery. I ordered the package with the travel charger, two extra batteries, and floatation strap because I read that the batteries go fast.  As long as I fully charged the batteries before going out I never had a battery life problem.  The first day I ran out of battery fast but that's because I didn't fully charge it.  Still don't regret getting the two extra batteries though.  So happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Alexa Schneider
Reviews.Content: used it in the bahamas last month and didn't have any problems. took great photos. it is better thank the pentax.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - move over GoPro
Reviews.Author: Barry Whaling
Reviews.Content: My son wanted an underwater camera for Maui.  After reading reviews, we decided on this model.  He's thrilled with the picture quality, video and audio.  You will need a memory card, but for the money, I don't think you can do better.  Easy to use and crystal clear.

Reviews.Title: Here is your favorite new camera
Reviews.Author: Cory M Hendrix
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. It turns on fast, has great shutter speed, a nice big viewing screen. Everything you could want in a compact except gps. It has to connect to your phone to get the location data. Still working that out. Still a great camera

Reviews.Title: Survived a week long trip rafting through the Grand Canyon's Colorado River
Reviews.Author: LozMo4s
Reviews.Content: Went rafting through the Grand Canyon a few weeks ago. We went through Class 10 rapids, rain, and sand storms. I was armed with my GoPro and my XP200 (Yellow is cheaper btw) point and shoot camera. The Camera performed exactly as I expected. The action shots came out great. The optical zoom allows for great close shots of faraway objects and I was able to pull it out, power it on, and shoot pictures on the fly with very little issue. The video looks great too. It has a dedicated Video button to record at any time.  Got some great shots and vids where the rapids drenched me with cold river water. The sensor(camera eye) has a thick glass to protect it from the temperature changes. Any fog or water droplets that dried on the sensor glass were easily wiped away. Jumped into the river while making a video and there were no skips or issues when reviewing the file. Remember this is a point and shoot, lighting is on you. Far away shots with light behind the subject will give you a silhouette. It happens. Other than that. A+++Pros: Easy to use. SR Auto feature did a really good job in picking out the right settings for great photos. Waterproof, dust proof, shockproof. This camera is pretty much life proof.Cons: Missed getting pictures of the beautiful Milky Way at night. The Night-mode is very novice. It is designed for brighter city lights.  I wish they had added a shutter timer (this would have removed the only con i had), but its water proof/ruggedness more than makes up for that one feature I missed.I definitely recommend this camera to any outdoor enthusiast that isn't looking to put their expensive SLR's at risk.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Richard Arsenault
Reviews.Content: Been using Fujifilm XP for 6-7 years now and the camera's keep getting better and better. still need a little work on transferring pics to smart phone

Reviews.Title: A great camera for the price! Not perfect, but darn close...
Reviews.Author: SnowMountainsRiversGuy
Reviews.Content: We purchased the XP200 for a trip to Belize that was mostly snorkeling, sea kayaking, surf sports, and a little scuba. My prime reasons for choosing it were the increased depth rating (50ft) and the fact that it used the same batteries as the Fujifilm XP100 that we already owned that we had bought for a similar trip to Hawaii (we learned that it would be best if ALL snorkelers/divers had their own camera).  The XP200 performed admirably in all conditions. It has some well-appreciated upgrades from the XP100: a much better and easier-to-trust hatch closure latch, easier-to-use zoom control, and very accessible multi-frame (speed shooting) button that is not menu-dependent.  It has plenty of "shooting condition" exposure options in the menu, and the SR-Auto setting worked well for everything except underwater, for which there are two separate special settings anyway.  For a point-n-shoot with a tiny flash, this thing took some AMAZING underwater photos in the crystal-clear waters of Belize.  I took it on 3 scuba dives, every one to just slightly beyond the 50ft camera rating, and it functioned flawlessly and did not implode.  For snorkeling and kayaking, this thing is amazing.  The lens coating that Fuji has developed sheds water almost perfectly every time, and out of nearly 1600 trip photos, I only got two or three with water drops on the lens.  That is hard to beat. I'm not a huge fan of video, but I shot some underwater at 8ft of a moray eel eating a lionfish I had speared, and it came out brilliant, too.  Is this camera as good as a DSLR??? No, your photos might not be quite as super-clear, and may need a little "help" from some of the awesome photo-editing programs out there (I am a huge fan of Picasa). But, you can slide this thing down inside a lifejacket and not know it's there, and have it on its very strong wrist leash while you snorkel or make moderate-depth scuba dives, and bring back some pretty amazing pictures without feeling weighed down by a boat anchor.  Overall, very satisfied with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Judy V.
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a water filled vacation in Cancun.The set up was simple, we didnt have a problem with charging the battery inside the camera. Others have written that they didnt like this feature but it was not an issue.The photos came out clear as long as you were in clear water and your subject was not to far away. The flash was capable of illuminating the subject quite well if not more that 20 ft away.No problems with water getting inside the camera, we went snorkeling , scuba diving, and to the beach.Great camera  for the price

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor camera
Reviews.Author: james mccloskey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera primary for taking on fishing trips and I am extremely satisfied with it so far. It takes great pics outside and even took one under water of a trout on my stringer. Zoom is limited and pics inside under low light aren't always the best but I would buy the camera again. It paid for itself the first time I slipped and fell in the water with it. 4 stars for this camera and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: DIYSDale
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just before going on vacation with two other people that already owned underwater cameras.  I used this camera in the in salt water for hours without any issues.  I kept this camera in the pocket of my swim suit while in the pool for hours.  This camera worked perfect.  My camera was the only camera out of the three that worked perfect.  It takes excelent pictures.  the battery life was good.  If I had to complain about something it would be that it was a little difficult to attach to battery charging cord into the camera because of the location being so close to the waterproof door.  I used this camera in fifty feet of water and it worked great.  I would recomend this camera to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Vacation Camera
Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: Many people are using cell phones for their photos today, but this is the perfect vacation camera.  It takes amazing photos, is waterproof, and you can drop it without it exploding.  Highly recommended for people who take active vacations and want to capture everything above and below the water.  This camera is not as small as some, but it fits in the pocket of cargo shorts and does exactly what I purchased it for.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: Feeling good Mom
Reviews.Content: Great camera, underwater or as a regular camera. Takes great pictures and videos.The under cater pics are very clear, colors are true, couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: loved it!
Reviews.Author: rachel cazee
Reviews.Content: I had a few reservations about this camera after some of the reviews.  I opted to buy it anyway and took it on a seven day cruise. I was able to take some awesome pictures and they turned out phenomenal.  Several other people had cameras that they spent way more money on and I ended up with the majority of the best pictures. It was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!! I love my camera!!
Reviews.Author: Ronaldo Bastos
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to buy a good quality water proof camera, but didn't know which one to buy. I'm really happy with this one. It's the best in the market and for such a good price. The pictures are amazing under and outside the water.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: Glenn T. Rupert
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera person, and this one is very easy to use.  Picture quality is fantastic, user interface is intuitive and buttons are easy to find.  My 11 year old was taking pictures in the pool immediately with this camera.  When I purchased this camera, I was unaware of the WiFi wireless transfer of pictures directly from the camera to the computer with no cable!  Set up on the PC/Mac and the camera was easy.  Just register the camera to the WiFi network and install computer software from the Fuji site.  I have a Mac and it worked great.  It downloaded 127 pictures in less than 5 minutes with no failures.  For me this sets a new bar in terms of what I expect from a digital camera and it's interface with my computer.  There is even a Camera app for your smartphone that will allow the transfer of pictures from the camera to the phone.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: mark Del Vecchio
Reviews.Content: I had some issues with the first camera I received (would shut down on hot days), but the second one is working great.I like the fact that this can take 1080p video (under water as well), and snap stills at the same time without interruption to the video. You have to be very steady when taking video, but they turn out well.Also, a great feature is the WiFi capability. the software doesn't work on my Mac consistently (it won't connect to the laptop), but you have to go through the setup again and it will. This feature allows you to download or upload to and from your camera and PC or handheld device. The connection problem is not so great but I have to try it on my PC. Other than that, I really like this camera. Great photos too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Guilherme
Reviews.Content: Easy and fast. I took it to my baby's swimming class to take pictures at the pool and it was great!!

Reviews.Title: takes great pics
Reviews.Author: JDA
Reviews.Content: Took it on vacation to Mexico and it took great pics snorkeling and also out of the water. One of our tour guides took a picture of us with it and asked if he could buy the camera from us!...he is an avid scuba diver. Very pleased with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Replace the XP70
Reviews.Author: Tina Lloyd
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace a well-used XP70. This camera has fantastic updates and is terrific quality like the XP70. Wish they had it in orange!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Kjf
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures. I have already taken it three times while riding in the back country snowmobiling. Next is to see how it works underwater diving in Mexico with my family.

Reviews.Title: Worked great under water!
Reviews.Author: M. Ernestine
Reviews.Content: The camera worked great under water,but be careful when using it not under the water. Wipe off the lens,in order to avoid water drops on your pics. Wasn't really thinking about that part ,but that would make sense.Camera took really nice pics. Overall happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Does everything I expected
Reviews.Author: Ambrose Contreras
Reviews.Content: I own the Z60 which has performed and performed.  This camera does much better.  I have a larger Pro Format camera and this camera can still outshine it with some of it's features.  This camera is well worth the money and very rugged.

Reviews.Title: Good quality camera
Reviews.Author: Teresa Wohlwend
Reviews.Content: It takes wonderful pictures.  The only reason I gave a 4 is I had to purchase an adapter for US power to charge the battery.  It came with a power adapter that doesn't work with US power plugs.

Reviews.Title: so far so good!
Reviews.Author: terrence m lewis
Reviews.Content: i treated myself to a go pro3plus  a few months ago and my son has been laying a guilt trip on me every time i see him about him not having a go pro…rather than buying him a go pro, to shut him up i bought this camera hoping  to  buy him off at half the price….received it lightening quick from amazon at a price nobody came close to….it is cooler than i thought and really well built with great pics and video…it looks like it will hold up well even in the marine environment.

Reviews.Title: nice underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Lyliani
Reviews.Content: Took this camera snorkeling with me during a week in Mexico. No troubles with video or pictures in or out of the water. Buy extra batteries. It would take about a day's worth of pics before the battery ran out, and then you had to let it dry before opening the battery / memory card compartment. It's easier to get a separate battery charger and a back up battery so you can have that charging. We got the Wasabi Power Battery 2pack and charger along with the camera and I'm happy we did!Also, you don't need a float strap. It comes with a wrist strap and a length adjuster so you can make sure it's tight on your wrist. Took it parasailing too - you won't lose it :)

Reviews.Title: i like it
Reviews.Author: maria solari
Reviews.Content: take greats pictures and amazing videos, and the construction is solid, thr duration of the battery is not optimal but  i really like it

Reviews.Title: Durable features-loaded camera that's great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Robert Henderson
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month now and have taken it hiking, lava tubing and snorkeling.  Great pictures in all settings.  The auto settings cover darn near all situations that I come across.  And I'm still learning about all the other bells and whistles.  Also got the additional battery/charger & I use a yellow Chums floatie wrist strap with it.  Also got the Logic DCB-302 Compact Case which fits the camera just fine.

Reviews.Title: I really like this camera
Reviews.Author: Federico Cirri
Reviews.Content: I like the color of the pictures.I just used in Disney World and the pictures are better than I expected, especially those of the fireworks, amazing the response of the camera!!!I would suggest this camera to everybody

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: takes great pictures-cant wait to use it when we ride the Colorado River on vacationalso bought the float just in case

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: anomad
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. This is the second Fuji camera I have owned.  I bought this to take out on my fishing kayak. This is a great camera for the price, shock proof, water proof and freeze proof and takes great photos.  The built in Wifi makes it easy to download photos of my caught fish to my IPad. Nomad

Reviews.Title: I'd certainly buy this camera again
Reviews.Author: smartk9s "smartk9s"
Reviews.Content: This camera has so many features for the $$$ it's amazing. Images are sharp. The only negative is that it is very easy to get your finger in front of the lens...but you'll quickly learn to be careful about that. Videos are just as crisp as still images. Would be nice if Fuji offered an "add on" lens system for times when you need more serious telephoto. I've used it everywhere from sun bright beaches to indoors and every shot was well exposed.

Reviews.Title: point n shot in any condition
Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: Works great for college when landscape shots are needed for ref. in graphic design and digital illustration. plus it is 'kiddo proof' so far all other digitals i had only lasted one drop from kiddo, this one has taken a beating and you couldn't tell because it still works. even when it starts raining during an outdoor sporting event, I am not worried about taking cover and I can keep on snapping shots of my son.

Reviews.Title: Good indoors, underwater not tested yet.
Reviews.Author: Kathy Moriarity
Reviews.Content: I have not tried this underwater yet, but it works fine indoors. I needed to suppress the flash or it was too washed out. I am going to try it underwater later this month and would love to report after that.

Reviews.Title: Well Thought of...
Reviews.Author: Feliseo Ochoa
Reviews.Content: We used it in Hawaii last month taking pictures inside the Diamond Head crater and underwater video of fish as we swim at Hanauma Bay. No water leak in camera. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: HealthyChic
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  Good battery life and easy to use.  We used this camera underwater and in very rugged terrain and it help up perfectly.  Only downside is it can be difficult to insert the charging cable into the very tiny port.

Reviews.Title: Great with young kids using and round camera
Reviews.Author: Wojo "Happy mama"
Reviews.Content: We got this because we were expecting our second child and we have not been disappointed! The fact that it is water proof and drop resistant has been great with our older child who loves taking pics of the new baby!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for a decent price.
Reviews.Author: Carl D Mueller
Reviews.Content: Good camera at a decent price. I would buy an extra battery and keep it changed. i wouuld also suggest you buy an extra big SD card, I purchased the 32GB one and it seems like enough so far. Fun and easy to use and I cannot wait to try it while diving.

Reviews.Title: Best little camera I've owned
Reviews.Author: Larry Ciak
Reviews.Content: Love it. Took pictures right out of the box. Simple to use yet very powerful for documenting issues in my line of work.

Reviews.Title: Love it - I have used it alot.
Reviews.Author: BigO
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for two reasons:  1 – upcoming vacation to the Caribbean; 2 – for outside in / around our pool.  The camera is very easy to use for taking pictures / videos and for getting them off of the device to share them.  It was pretty nice being able to use the strap to keep it around my wrist in the ocean or in my pocket in the pool.Using the video portion is also very easy and starts recording quickly.  There is not much to dislike about the camera.  I only wish I had purchased it previously to get more use out of it.I should note the quality of the pictures is very good for the price we paid.  If you are more of an expert camera person, then there are other ones for you to choose from.  I gave it 5 stars based upon the price, ease of use, and quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: diveman05
Reviews.Content: So far so good, i haven't taken it to depth yet but it works great for in the water photos or on the ground.  Great in low light, starts up quick and takes a picture right away.  Overall happy

Reviews.Title: Easy as Pie....
Reviews.Author: R. Roberts
Reviews.Content: Easy, great pics in and out of water. Great video. Wifi link. Only Con: User manual on disc, so no bringing it out with you for quick references. So glad it picked this Camera.

Reviews.Title: Just love it!!!
Reviews.Author: marrijardim
Reviews.Content: Great product!!! Good quality pictures/movies under water, also good fixture, easy to use and nice design.Best buyer Love it!!

Reviews.Title: meet all my needs
Reviews.Author: nathalie Beaudoin
Reviews.Content: Work very well, meet my needs. The booklet explain very well how to use it. I didn't try the video yet but I am glad of the quality of the picture

Reviews.Title: After the first day in aquapark, got very foggy and broken
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and used it only for one day. Although it looks sturdy and is positioned as waterproof, after swimming in aquapark for 1 hour, the screen and the lens got foggy and the camera stopped operating. The battery compartment was well-closed - checked it several times.I like the size and the quality of the case, as well as photo and video taking, just a pity that it didn't respond to the waterproof claim.Going to return it back to seller and look for alternative.

Reviews.Title: Does everything it said it does
Reviews.Author: Jim Mahar
Reviews.Content: camera is compact and take clear pictures, great camera for active use  Can't wait to try it underwater.  Should be good on the boat ..

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT
Reviews.Author: hector rodriguez
Reviews.Content: OK THE PRODUCT IN THE FUNCTION ALL, BUT THE ZOOM NOT TO MUCH. THE GUALITY PICTURES IS THE BEST. THANK

Reviews.Title: awesome quality pictures
Reviews.Author: nc coonhound
Reviews.Content: Took this camera  for a rugged 8 day trip hiking and snorkeling.  Once I figured out how to set the camera for best shot it was party time. Another traveller had the same camera - once you flip through the options you realize what a sweet camera this is.  Underwater shots were so cool.  The water was a bit stirred up so the camera will not cut through that obviously but I caught schools of fish, turtles swimming etc on the video - even sound was recorded underwater!  Hooking up to tv to see on larger screen was ez as well- have not tried the wifi.I would definitely get the extra battery and keep one charging at all times- when actively shooting - battery power dies - especially if using video.  Yet, while stored battery power is maintained for 3-4 weeks which really surprised me.  All in all I am really happy.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a kid
Reviews.Author: Marcie Albertsen "Marcie"
Reviews.Content: Bouth this for my 11 yr old's birthday and she loves it.  I don't have to worry about her dropping it or getting it wet.  Taking it to Hawaiii in a month.  Will see how it does in the sand and water.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for our honeymoon
Reviews.Author: SD210
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to be our only camera with us on our honeymoon to Hawaii.  I wanted something that I could take into the water with me.  We are not "camera people" who are into all the bells and whistles.  We just wanted something with decent megapixels that could shoot both underwater and on land.  I thought this camera did a great job at both, once we figured out how to adjust all the settings.  I also like the fact that this camera has a nice hard body - - I dropped it a couple of times while on our trip and it was fine.  I think this is a fun little camera that you can take in and out of the water.  My husband got some good nightime photos with it when we were at the Volcano national park, and we got some great sunset shots as well (it even has a "sunset" setting).  Great for travel, if you are a casual photographer.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price.
Reviews.Author: Practical Person
Reviews.Content: So far so good with the XP200. It does a nice job for the price. I did notice like others that the battery does not last as long as one might think it should. I also noticed that the price on these is all over the place $222 - $280. So if you are reading this prior to purchase like most things on Amazon watch the price over a week or so checking at different times of the day for the best deal. Amazon did price match my purchase the same day. Amazon as always has 5 star customer service.

Reviews.Title: Good but not Great!
Reviews.Author: Monica DiGiralomo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for our vacation to an island and for taking pictures under water.  The quality of the pictures is great, but I was disappointed with the quality of the video.  There were some lines going across once I uploaded the videos into my computer.  I actually returned it and got the Nikon AW110 instead, and I'm extremely happy with it.  I strongly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing value for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert Howe
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Fuji camera and second water resistant one. I have all and continue to use when on holiday or where have you.As a travel camera that is not complicated and easy to use .  The capture of subject is perfect for our needs. Former airline employee and have used all of my Fuji Fine Pix and XP models without worrying about theft or minor drops - bumps etc.Value For Me  5 STARS

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Giovanny Perez
Reviews.Content: Indoor lighting picture quality was sub par to what is described.  it Should only be used in full sun situations.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera and huge waste of money
Reviews.Author: Dawn M. Vaughn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip I was going on and I was so exited to have an under water camera to use on my trip to Cancun.  The weather in Cancun was a bit rainy so I didn't get to use the camera as much as I had hoped and only used it in the pool once.  After using it, I followed the directions for rinsing it off ad allowing it to try but to my surprise, the next time I went to use the camera (which wasn't until several months later), it didn't work.  It turns on to allow you to download pictures but when you turn it on when it's not plugged into the PC via a USB, the screen is black and it won't do anything.  I have charged the battery, replaced the battery, and looked for any build up inside but it looks fine.  Of course it is to late to return it through Amazon (note to self to not buy electronics for a trip well in advance of the trip) and Fuji won't do anything.  Because it is an underwater camera they always use the "operator error" line.  This was the biggest waste of money and I will never buy another Fuji product again (this is the second Fuji camera that was short lived).  I will also think twice about ordering electronics through amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera.
Reviews.Author: David Marcoux "Dragonrydr"
Reviews.Content: Great all around camera that can literally go anywhere with me... From skiing to hunting in the rain to scuba. Takes great picts and video in a compact, pocket sized camera. I had a Fuji WP for years and this is a big step up. price is more than reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Really nice underwater camera.
Reviews.Author: James Rhodes "Deep Thought"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera but haven't used it much.  I dropped my old Panasonic Lumix underwater camera on a recent outdoor excursion into some deep chasm at Johnson's Shut-ins State Park and I needed a new camera so I got this one.  It has an HDR mode that you need to be careful with as that mode really requires a tripod due to the long exposure times.  It is also bulkier than my old Lumix, but it also seems better constructed.

Reviews.Title: Nature Instructor
Reviews.Author: Martin W
Reviews.Content: size is inportant I  carry it in my cargo pocket great to  use it in the field or in snow

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Melanie Gale
Reviews.Content: This is my second XP underwater camera.  I bought this one because it has a deeper depth for taking underwater photos.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Stevso "Steven"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera.  I was disappointed by the wifi. It's not true wifi, you need to download the apps and then try to get them to work.  Really had to research to find instructions on how to use the app and get the camera to work with multiple devices.The wifi means that the camera will talk to the apps in order to download the pictures to your devices, in my case the iPhone and iPad.  There also some timing issues with getting them to see each other.  Also, you have to disconnect or delete the previous device you synced it to in order for it to see a different device.  I thought it would be easier than using the cable to transfer the pictures, but with the syncing and resets, it's easier to use the cables.Other than that it takes nice pictures.
